interfaces

Interface ILogging

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeywordLogger

    public interface ILogging
    Primary interface used for Logging within the framework Logging is designed to use an interface so that any type of logging library can be used without issues of refactoring. Currently log4j is the provided logging library for the framework
    Author:
    Mathew Carrigan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IAAALogEvent actSection(java.lang.String message)
      Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Act section of the test case The Act section of a test case is the primary action that the test case is testing - referred to as the spirit of the test case
      IAAALogEvent arrangeSection(java.lang.String message)
      Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Arrange section of the test case The Arrange section of a test case is any steps required to in order to get to the primary Act section of a test case.
      IAAALogEvent assertSection(java.lang.String message)
      Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Assert section of the test case The Assert section of a test case is the validation that the actions performed in the Act section happened as expected.
      void beginKeyword(IKeyword<?> keyword)
      Log message to be written before a keyword is executed

      Log message to be written before a keyword is executed
      IAAALogEvent cleanupSection(java.lang.String message)
      Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Cleanup section of the test case The Cleanup section of a test case is any cleanup or breakdown needed after a test is complete to return the environment into is past state.

      • beginKeyword

        void beginKeyword(IKeyword<?> keyword)
        Log message to be written before a keyword is executed
        Parameters:
        keyword - Instance of the Keyword being called - Pass in 'this' as the parameter

      • beginKeyword

        void beginKeyword(IKeyword<?> keyword,
                  org.openqa.selenium.By locator)
        Log message to be written before a keyword is executed
        Parameters:
        keyword - Instance of the Keyword being called - Pass in 'this' as the parameter
        locator - Selenium By locator. If a keyword class has overloaded constructors one of which takes a By and the other takes a WebElement it is acceptable to still pass the By locator in as this method should check if the locator is null and process accordingly

      • beginKeyword

        void beginKeyword(IKeyword<?> keyword,
                  org.openqa.selenium.By... locators)
        Log message to be written before a keyword is executed
        Parameters:
        keyword - Instance of the Keyword being called - Pass in 'this' as the parameter
        locators - Selenium By locators. If a keyword class has overloaded constructors one of which takes 1 or more By locators and the other takes WebElement/s it is acceptable to still pass the By locator in as this method should check if the locator is null and process accordingly

      • beginKeyword

        void beginKeyword(IKeyword<?> keyword,
                  java.lang.String additionalInfo,
                  org.openqa.selenium.By... locators)
        Log message to be written before a keyword is executed
        Parameters:
        keyword - Instance of the Keyword being called - Pass in 'this' as the parameter
        additionalInfo - String of any additional information to display. Example SendKeys keyword logs an additionalInfo message of the keys being sent by the keyword
        locators - Selenium By locators. If a keyword class has overloaded constructors one of which takes 1 or more By locators and the other takes WebElement/s it is acceptable to still pass the By locator in as this method should check if the locator is null and process accordingly

      • beginKeyword

                  java.lang.String additionalInfo)

        Parameters:
        keyword - Instance of the Keyword being called - Pass in 'this' as the parameter
        additionalInfo - String of any additional information to display. Example SendKeys keyword logs an additionalInfo message of the keys being sent by the keyword
        locator - Selenium By locator. If a keyword class has overloaded constructors one of which takes a By and the other takes a WebElement it is acceptable to still pass the By locator in as this method should check if the locator is null and process accordingly

      • endKeyword

        void endKeyword(IKeyword<?> keyword)
        Log message to be written upon completion of a keyword perform() method
        Parameters:
        keyword - Instance of the Keyword being called - Pass in 'this' as the parameter

      • arrangeSection

        IAAALogEvent arrangeSection(java.lang.String message)
        Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Arrange section of the test case The Arrange section of a test case is any steps required to in order to get to the primary Act section of a test case. Example: Authenticating and navigating to the billing section in order to test Billing feature
        Parameters:
        message - Description of what is taking place in the Assert Section. Example: 'Navigating to the portal and authenticating as a Primary User'
        Returns:
        an instance of IAAALogEvent to be logged

      • actSection

        IAAALogEvent actSection(java.lang.String message)
        Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Act section of the test case The Act section of a test case is the primary action that the test case is testing - referred to as the spirit of the test case
        Parameters:
        message - Description of what is taking place in the Arrange Section. Example: 'Paying full bill amount with preferred payment method'
        Returns:
        an instance of IAAALogEvent to be logged

      • assertSection

        IAAALogEvent assertSection(java.lang.String message)
        Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Assert section of the test case The Assert section of a test case is the validation that the actions performed in the Act section happened as expected.
        Parameters:
        message - Description of what is taking place in the Arrange Section. Example: 'Asserting there is a pending payment and current balance is 0 and that a successful transaction message is displayed after payment is sent'
        Returns:
        an instance of IAAALogEvent to be logged

      • cleanupSection

        IAAALogEvent cleanupSection(java.lang.String message)
        Used for Triple AAA Logging Pattern which breaks test cases down into several parts of Arrange, Act, Assert, and optionally Cleanup Generates a specially formatted log message indicating the current processing is in the Cleanup section of the test case The Cleanup section of a test case is any cleanup or breakdown needed after a test is complete to return the environment into is past state.
        Parameters:
        message - Description of what is taking place in the Arrange Section. Example: 'Canceling the payment and Closing the browser'
        Returns:
        an instance of IAAALogEvent to be logged

      • info

        void info(java.lang.String message)
        An Informational log event.
        Parameters:
        message - String message to written by the logger

        void error()

        void warn()

      • debug

        void debug()

      • getExtent

        com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentReports getExtent()
        This framework is designed to generate HTML reports designed by the ExtentReports Enterprise edition Java Library This method should return the current active Extent Reports instance
        Returns:
        ExtentReport instance @see ExtentReports
        See Also:
        http://extentreports.com/
